snippet: The candidacy of Narendra Modi, one of India’s most divisive politicians, for prime minister raises the prospect that next year’s national elections could be the deadliest in decades.
abstract: Candidacy of Narendra Modi, one of India’s most divisive politicians, for prime minister raises prospect that 2014 national elections could be the deadliest in decades; Modi, unapologetic Hindu chauvinist, has been accused of inciting violence against Muslims but appeals to some due to his charisma and vision of a resurgent India.

byline.contributor: Hari Kumar contributed reporting from Ahmedabad, and Nida Najar from Muzaffarnagar, India.

lead_paragraph: The candidacy of Narendra Modi, one of India’s most divisive politicians, for prime minister raises the prospect that next year’s national elections could be the deadliest in decades.

headline.main: Campaign for Prime Minister in India Gets Off to Violent Start
headline.print_headline: Campaign for Prime Minister in India Gets Off to Violent Start
